Steps Rationale
1. Wear sterile gloves and cleanse the external ear using a warm washcloth. Prevents transmission of microorganisms. Cleaning the external ear removes drainage or debris that may prevent the medication from entering the ear canal.
2. Place the client on a right side-lying position. Placing the client on the unaffected side prevents leakage of medication.
3. Pull the ear pinna back and up. Straightens ear canal in adult clients.
4. Administer medication on the side of the ear canal. Direct administration into the ear canal causes discomfort.
5. Release the ear pinna. Allows movement of the medication into the tympanic membrane.
6. Instruct the client to remain in the position for 5 minutes. Allows medication to stay in the ear.
